item.title: Fire Bottle Pressure Indication Systems (Engine, Lower Cargo, APU)

numlitem.para: Squib test is used to verify squib integrity, and
Procedure is used to verify that the associated bottle is full.

note.para: Not required for inoperative APU, main deck cargo or lower cargo fire extinguisher system.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard adjacent to SQUIB TEST module on the pilots overhead panel: "FIRE BOTTLE PRESS IND SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: This MEL item includes associated lights and EICAS messages. Refer to MEL item 31-61-4-1 for possible relief with invalid EICAS status messages.

numlitem.para: Push and hold SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button, M7327 squib test module on P461 pilot’s overhead maintenance panel.
Observe that following indicating lights on M7327 illuminate (green):
All ENG 1, 2, 3, and 4 squib test lights.
All CARGO squib test lights.
The APU squib test light.

note.para: If optional two bottle system is installed, SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button will test APU Bottle A.

numlitem.para: Release the SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button.
Observe that all squib test indicating lights extinguish.
Push and hold SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button, M7327 squib test module on P461 pilot’s overhead maintenance panel.
Observe the following indicating lights on M7327 illuminate (green):
All ENG 1, 2, 3, and 4 squib test lights.
All CARGO squib test lights.
The APU squib test light.

note.para: If optional two bottle system is installed, SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button will test APU Bottle B.

numlitem.para: Release the SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button.
Observe that all squib test indicating lights extinguish.
Remove electrical power if no longer required.
Perform the following tests:
ENGINE Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-21-00/501).
APU Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-22-00/501).
LOWER CARGO Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-23-00/501).
MAIN DECK Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-24-00/501).
If above tests fail, remove and weigh the bottle.
LOWER CARGO (AMM 26-23-01/401 and AMM 26-24-01/601).
Disconnect, cap and stow the affected bottle’s Pressure Switch connector after serviceable bottle weight is confirmed.
